panels.description: Number of active queries deployed in the cluster.
panels.title: ksqlDB: Sum of Active Queries

panels.description:
Number of running queries deployed in the cluster.
            Ideally, this number should be equal to the number of active queries as queries should be running.
panels.title: ksqlDB: Sum of Running Queries

panels.description:
Number of queries rebalancing in the cluster.
            Ideally, this number should be equal zero, or return to zero in a short period (e.g. 1 minute).
            It's recommended to alert if the number of rebalancing queries stay higher than 0 for a longer period of time.
panels.title: ksqlDB: Sum of Rebalancing Queries

panels.description:
Number of queries failed in the cluster.
            Ideally, this number should be equal zero.
            It's recommended to alert if the number of queries failed is higher than 0.
panels.title: Connect: Sum of Queries Failed

panels.description:
Rate of CPU seconds used by the Java process.
            100% usage represents one core. 
            If there are multiple cores, the total capacity should be 100% * number_cores.
panels.title: CPU usage

panels.description: Sum of JVM memory used, without including areas (e.g. heap size).
panels.title: Memory usage

panels.description: Sum of seconds used by Garbage Collection.
panels.title: GC collection
